question: Two steel plates with Sy = 50 ksi are attached by 3/8-in. parallel-loaded fillet welds, as shown in Figure. E60 series welding rods are used, and good welding practice is followed. Each of the welds is 3 in. long. With a safety factor of 3, what maximum tensile load can be applied?<image 1>
description: The image shows two steel plates attached by parallel-loaded fillet welds. The plates are connected using E60 series welding rods. The welds are 3 inches long each, and there are two such welds. The yield strength (Sy) of the steel plates is 50 ksi (kilopounds per square inch). The diameter of the welding rods is 0.375 inches. A safety factor (SF) of 3 is applied to ensure structural integrity.
